what: Package users and their main interests
title: How to use the VegX R package
text: envisage two different kinds users VegX package: Create new VegX documents Add information plot location, plot shape site characteristics. Add vegetation observations different kinds: individual plants, aggregated cover values, strata observations… Add site observations (e.g. abiotic measurements). Provide information taxon concepts related organism identifications. Provide information research project contact information. Write Veg-X XML files supported export formats. Load Veg-X XML files. Merge several Veg-X objects different sources. Assess degree compatibility different source data. Harmonize measurement units taxonomic nomenclature across data sets. Generate new observations given level vegetation resolution aggregating data lower level (e.g. individual tree diameters basal area estimates). Export data formats suitable analysis.

what: Installing the package and loading source data
title: How to use the VegX R package
text: VegX package currently distributed GitHub. install , package devtools installed use following command: devtools::install_github("iavs-org/VegX", build_vignettes=TRUE). Assuming package already installed begin loading , results required package XML also loaded: User’s VegX package expected know import source data R, either using database connection reading files diverse formats (e.g. txt, csv, xlsx, …). examples manual, use three data sets extracted New Zealand National Vegetation Survey (NVS) Databank. subsets original datasets prepared demonstration purposes . Mokihinui forest: Forest riparian data 5 plots west coast South Island (New Zealand). data comprises ) site information plot; ii) cover scores taxa within height strata; iii) dbh measurement individual trees. Mt Fyffe forest: Forest data five permanent plots east coast South Island (New Zealand). data comprises ) site information plot; ii) cover scores taxa within height strata; iii) dbh measurement individual trees within subplots fully partition permanent plot; iv) counts saplings within subplots fully partition permanent plot; v) counts seedlings within height strata within subplots sample permanent plot. Two full measurements permanent plots provided. Takitimu grassland: Alpine grassland data 5 plots southern South Island (New Zealand). data comprises ) site information plot; ii) frequency values plant taxa based observations within subplots along transects; iii) groundcover; iv) disturbance. three data sets contains different tables, corresponding plot location, site observations, taxon observations, … simplicity, reduced number plots example data set five, although data sets contain subplots. three data sets included package, load data three data sets R workspace using:
code: library(VegX) data(mokihinui) data(mtfyffe) data(takitimu) ls() ##  [1] "moki_dia"            "moki_loc"            "moki_lookup"         ##  [4] "moki_site"           "moki_str"            "moki_tcv"            ##  [7] "mtfyffe_counts"      "mtfyffe_dia"         "mtfyffe_disturbance" ## [10] "mtfyffe_groundcover" "mtfyffe_loc"         "mtfyffe_lookup"      ## [13] "mtfyffe_site"        "taki_disturbance"    "taki_freq"           ## [16] "taki_groundcover"    "taki_loc"            "taki_lookup"         ## [19] "taki_site"

Thus, begin introducing plot survey information, followed observations individual organisms, taxa, strata, etc. Later sections manual deal functions facilitate data integration harmonization.

However, introduce data describing project: Veg-X package provides function fillProjectInformation() fill project data. can used fill data existing project (identified title) define new project. case data introduced directly text parameters function, instead read data frame. example, provide information project led collection data Mokihinui forest: Note filling information project led definition personnel involved project. Hence, define new mapping use function addPlotLocations(): defining mapping xand yare used map coordinates. also include plotName, otherwise function know match coordinates plots already defined moki_vegx (subPlotName included coordinates available subplots). Parameter proj4string used supply spatial reference system coordinates. console output indicates new plots added (previously defined), started populating empty Veg-X object using addPlotLocations(). can inspect data recently entered using following command: calling showElementTable() plot elements showing plot/sub-plot relationships. Note sub-plots explicit coordinates associated (given moki_loc). user provide source data. Using mapping can parse coordinates Mt Fyffe forest data set: example, 8 records parsed, coordinates availble four plots . Coordinate records duplicated mtfyffe_loc, provided independently survey. function addPlotLocations() keep recently read location records plot. Finally, parse plot coordinates Takikimu grassland data set, realizing missing three plots. function addPlotLocations() accepts coordinates spatial reference system (specified using parameter proj4string). title: How to use the VegX R package
text: x y specify horizontal plot position, vertical position plot specified using elevation (normally sea level). Since plot elevation measurement, important specify measurement method (.e. instruments) measurement scale (.e. measurement units) metadata decreases potential errors pooling data different sources. Veg-X standard, information specified via defining method attribute elements, whereas VegX package S4 class named VegXMethod encapsulates things. Users can define methods, package provides function predefinedMeasurementMethod() easily define methods common variables. example, can define measurement elevation meters sea level using: Plot elevation added Veg-X documents using addPlotLocations() . However, Mokihinui data set elevation included data frame moki_site (moki_loc), add using call used plot coordinates. elevation method defined, use : parent plots elevation data (.e., records sub-plots missing). inspect plot elements document find elevation data added plot coordinates: Analogous calls addPlotLocations() can made fill elevation data Mt Fyffe forest Takitimu grassland data sets: Note case specified method elevation using string directly. avoids call function predefinedMeasurementMethod().
code: elevMethod = predefinedMeasurementMethod("Elevation/m") mapping = list(plotName = "Plot", elevation = "Altitude") moki_vegx = addPlotLocations(moki_vegx, moki_site, mapping,                               methods = list(elevation = elevMethod)) ##  Measurement method 'Elevation/m' added for 'elevation'. ##  5 plot(s) parsed, 0 new plot(s) added. ##  25 record(s) parsed. ##  20 record(s) with missing value(s) not added. head(showElementTable(moki_vegx, "plot"),3) ##    plotName   coordX   coordY           spatialReference elevation_method ## 1    LGM08r 172.1407 -41.5417 +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84      Elevation/m ## 2 LGM08r_1Q       NA       NA                       <NA>             <NA> ## 3 LGM08r_2Q       NA       NA                       <NA>             <NA> ##   elevation_value relatedPlotName plotRelationship ## 1              95            <NA>             <NA> ## 2              NA          LGM08r          subplot ## 3              NA          LGM08r          subplot mtfyffe_vegx = addPlotLocations(mtfyffe_vegx, mtfyffe_site, mapping,                                 methods = c(elevation = elevMethod)) ##  Measurement method 'Elevation/m' added for 'elevation'. ##  4 plot(s) parsed, 0 new plot(s) added. ##  326 record(s) parsed. ##  318 record(s) with missing value(s) not added. taki_vegx = addPlotLocations(taki_vegx, taki_site, mapping,                               methods = list(elevation = "Elevation/m")) ##  Measurement method 'Elevation/m' added for 'elevation'. ##  5 plot(s) parsed, 0 new plot(s) added. ##  5 record(s) parsed.

what: Why a vegetation data exchange standard?

text: primary technical impediment large-scale sharing vegetation data lack recognized international exchange standard linking panoply tools database implementations exist among various organizations individuals participating vegetation research. absence exchange standard, need multiple, ad hoc mappings among databases applications discourages merging data slows development new analytical tools (Fig. 1a). contrast, widespread use common exchange standard avoid need repeatedly map data synthetic projects requiring single mapping given database tool standard (Fig. 1b), thus facilitating data exchange analysis. Schematic diagram showing () problem: multiple tools databases (b) solution: sharing tools common standard.

title: Add aggregate organism observation records — addAggregateOrganismObservations
text: target initial object class VegX modified x data frame row corresponds one aggregate organism observation. Columns can varied. mapping named list whose elements strings correspond column names x. Names list : plotName - string identifying vegetation plot within data set (required). subPlotName - string identifying subplot plot given plotName (optional). obsStartDate - Plot observation start date (required; see date.format). organismName - string name, defined dataset author, follow nomenclatural codes. taxonName - string taxon name (necessarily including authority). stratumName - string used identify stratum (see stratumDefinition; optional). heightMeasurement - Optional height aggregated observation made, e.g. meters. applies aggregate measurements (optional). ... - User defined names used map aggregate organism measurements, percent cover (optional). methods list measurement methods heightMeasurement user defined aggregate organism measurements (method object class VegXMethodDefinition). Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined methods exist (see predefinedMeasurementMethod). stratumDefinition object class VegXStrataDefinition indicating definition strata. date.format character string specifying input format dates (see .Date). missing.values character vector values considered missing observations/measurements. verbose boolean flag indicate console output data integration process.

title: Add aggregate organism observation records — addAggregateOrganismObservations
text: modified object class VegX.

title: Add aggregate organism observation records — addAggregateOrganismObservations
text: mapping include either organismName  taxonName, can include source data set contains taxon names  others taxa. Missing value policy: Missing plotName obsStartDate values interpreted previous non-missing value used define aggregate organism observation. Missing subPlotName values interpreted observation refers parent plotName. stratumName values missing aggregate organism observation assigned stratum. organismName taxonName missing (.e. missing organism identity) function generates error. Missing aggregate organism measurements added Veg-X document.

text: target initial object class VegX modified x data frame row corresponds one plot. Columns can varied. mapping named list whose elements strings correspond column names x. (optional). Note placeName placeType add new places list places. proj4string string projection attributes (see proj4string package sp) used 'x' 'y' supplied.  parameter needed toWGS84 = TRUE. reset.places Whether 'places' vector reset adding new place names. toWGS84 boolean flag indicate coordinates transformed "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84". methods named list measurement methods plot horizontal/vertical location measurements (object class VegXMethodDefinition).  Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined methods exist (see predefinedMeasurementMethod). example, methods = c(xy = method1, elevation = method2). title: Add plot observation records — addPlotObservations
text: target initial object class VegX modified x data frame row corresponds one plot observation. Columns can varied. mapping named list whose elements strings correspond column names x. Names list : plotName - string identifying vegetation plot within data set (required). subPlotName - string identifying subplot plot given plotName (optional). obsStartDate - Plot observation start date (required; see date.format). projectTitle - Title project related plot observation (optional). obsEndDate - Plot observation end date (optional; see  date.format). observationParty - Name party undertook plot observation (optional). plotUniqueIdentifier - string used identify plot uniquely, preferably globally unique (optional). missing.values character vector values considered missing data (see details). date.format character string specifying input format dates (see .Date). verbose boolean flag indicate console output data integration process.

text: Named elements mapping beyond used function ignored. Missing value policy: Missing projectTitle, plotName, obsStartDate obsEndDate values interpreted previous non-missing value used define plot observation. Missing subPlotName values interpreted data refers parent plotName.

title: Adds/replaces site information — addSiteCharacteristics
text: target initial object class VegX modified x data frame row corresponds one plot observation. Columns can varied. mapping named list whose elements strings correspond column names x. Names list : plotName - string identifying vegetation plot within data set (required). subPlotName - string identifying subplot plot given plotName (optional). slope - Slope plot (optional). aspect - Aspect (.e. orientation) plot (optional). landform - Site land form (e.g. slope, ridge, saddle point; optional). parentMaterial - Underlying geological material (generally bedrock superficial drift deposit) soil horizons form. (optional). measurementMethods named list objects class VegXMethodDefinition measurement method site variables stated mapping. List names names site variables (e.g. list(aspect = aspectMeth) specify use method aspectMeth aspect measurements). Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined method exists (e.g. list(aspect = "Aspect/degrees")),  see predefinedMeasurementMethod. missing.values character vector values considered missing observations/measurements. verbose boolean flag indicate console output data integration process.

code: addSiteObservations(   target,   x,   plotObservationMapping,   soilMeasurementMapping = list(),   climateMeasurementMapping = list(),   waterBodyMeasurementMapping = list(),   soilMeasurementMethods = list(),   climateMeasurementMethods = list(),   waterBodyMeasurementMethods = list(),   date.format = "%Y-%m-%d",   missing.values = c(NA, ""),   fill.methods = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Add site observation records — addSiteObservations
text: target initial object class VegX modified x data frame row corresponds one plot observation. Columns can varied. plotObservationMapping list element names 'plotName', 'obsStartDate', used specify mapping data columns (specified using strings column names) onto variables. Additional optional mappings : 'subPlotName'. soilMeasurementMapping named list used specify mapping data columns soil variables (e.g. = "pH" map variable "pH" data frame). List names soilMeasurementMethods. climateMeasurementMapping named list used specify mapping data columns climate variables. List names climateMeasurementMethods. waterBodyMeasurementMapping named list used specify mapping data columns water body variables. List names waterBodyMeasurementMethods. soilMeasurementMethods named list objects class VegXMethodDefinition measurement method element names stated soilMeasurementMapping (e.g. list(= pHmeth) specify use method 'pHmeth' soil1).  Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined methods exist (e.g. list(= "pH/0-14") use predefined method "pH/0-14"),  see predefinedMeasurementMethod. climateMeasurementMethods named list objects class VegXMethodDefinition measurement method element names stated climateMeasurementMapping. List names climate subject measurement variables. Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined methods exist,  see predefinedMeasurementMethod. waterBodyMeasurementMethods named list objects class VegXMethodDefinition measurement method element names stated waterBodyMeasurementMapping. List names water body subject measurement variables. Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined methods exist,  see predefinedMeasurementMethod. date.format character string specifying input format dates (see .Date). missing.values character vector values considered missing observations/measurements. fill.methods flag indicate missing methods filled dummy ones. allows easily storing environmental data, without appropriate metadata. verbose boolean flag indicate console output data integration process.

title: Add site observation records — addSiteObservations
text: Unlike functions, element names mappings used find corresponding method. measured subject (e.g. pH, salinity mean annual temperature) taken method definition.  one exception rule: users can use fill.methods = TRUE skip defining methods environmental variables. case,  function define dummy measurement methods, taking element name mapping list subject. example, soilMeasurementMapping = list(pHvar = "pH") method provided pHvar soilMeasurementMethods, function create dummy measurement method called 'pHvar'. Although possibility given ease import, users encouraged define site measurement methods use predefined ones. defining measurement methods, users preferably name subjects using strings predefined methods, facilitates merging datasets entities measured.  Please contact Veg-X developers ask additional predefined measurement methods think rellevant exchanging vegetation plot data. Missing value policy: Missing 'plotName' 'obsStartDate' values interpreted previous non-missing value used define plot observation. Missing 'subPlotName' values interpreted observation refers parent plotName. Missing measurements simply added Veg-X document.

title: Add stratum observation records — addStratumObservations
text: target initial object class VegX modified x data frame row corresponds one stratum observation. Columns can varied. mapping named list whose elements strings correspond column names x. Names list : plotName - string identifying vegetation plot within data set (required). subPlotName - string identifying subplot plot given plotName (optional). obsStartDate - Plot observation start date (required; see date.format). stratumName - string used identify stratum (see stratumDefinition; required). lowerLimitMeasurement,  upperLimitMeasurement- Lower upper limits, respectively, strata (e.g. height limits m). ... - User defined names used map stratum measurements, percent cover (optional). methods list measurement methods lowerLimitMeasurement, upperLimitMeasurement stratum measurements (one object class VegXMethodDefinition).  Alternatively, methods can specified using strings predefined methods exist (see predefinedMeasurementMethod). stratumDefinition object class VegXStrataDefinition indicating definition strata. date.format character string specifying input format dates (see .Date). missing.values character vector values considered missing observations/measurements. verbose boolean flag indicate console output data integration process.

title: Add stratum observation records — addStratumObservations
text: modified object class VegX.

title: Add stratum observation records — addStratumObservations
text: Missing value policy: Missing plotName, obsStartDate stratumName values interpreted previous non-missing value used define plot observation. Missing subPlotName values interpreted observation refers parent plotName. Missing measurements simply added Veg-X document.

title: Add stratum observation records — addStratumObservations
code: # Load source data data(mokihinui)  # Define mapping mapping = list(plotName = "Plot", obsStartDate = "PlotObsStartDate",                 stratumName = "Tier",                lowerLimitMeasurement = "TierLower", upperLimitMeasurement = "TierUpper",                cover = "CoverClass")   # Define cover scale coverscale = defineOrdinalScaleMethod(name = "Recce cover scale",                    description = "Recce recording method by Hurst/Allen",                    subject = "plant cover",                    citation = "Hurst, JM and Allen, RB. (2007)                       The Recce method for describing New Zealand vegetation –                       Field protocols. Landcare Research, Lincoln.",                    codes = c("P","1","2","3", "4", "5", "6"),                    quantifiableCodes = c("1","2","3", "4", "5", "6"),                    breaks = c(0, 1, 5, 25, 50, 75, 100),                    midPoints = c(0.05, 0.5, 15, 37.5, 62.5, 87.5),                    definitions = c("Presence", "<1%", "1-5%","6-25%", "26-50%",                                     "51-75%", "76-100%"))   # Define strata strataDef = defineMixedStrata(name = "Recce strata",                    description = "Standard Recce stratum definition",                    citation = "Hurst, JM and Allen, RB. (2007)                         The Recce method for describing New Zealand vegetation –                         Field protocols. Landcare Research, Lincoln.",                    heightStrataBreaks = c(0, 0.3,2.0,5, 12, 25, 50),                    heightStrataNames = paste0("Tier ",1:6),                    categoryStrataNames = "Tier 7",                    categoryStrataDefinition = "Epiphytes")  # Create new Veg-X document with stratum observations x = addStratumObservations(newVegX(), moki_str, mapping = mapping,                         methods = list(lowerLimitMeasurement = "Stratum height/m",                                        upperLimitMeasurement = "Stratum height/m",                                        cover=coverscale),                         stratumDefinition = strataDef) #>  1 stratum measurement variables found. #>  Measurement method 'Stratum height/m' added for 'lowerLimitMeasurement'. #>  Measurement method 'Stratum height/m' for 'upperLimitMeasurement' already included. #>  Measurement method 'Recce cover scale' added for 'cover'. #>  Stratum definition method 'Recce strata' added. #>  7 new stratum definitions added. #>  5 plot(s) parsed, 5 new added. #>  5 plot observation(s) parsed, 5 new added. #>  35 record(s) parsed, 35 new stratum observation(s) added. #>  7 measurement(s) with missing value(s) not added.  # Examine results head(showElementTable(x, "stratumObservation")) #>   plotName obsStartDate stratumName lowerLimit_method lowerLimit_value #> 1   LGM38h   2011-02-20      Tier 1  Stratum height/m             25.0 #> 2   LGM38h   2011-02-20      Tier 2  Stratum height/m             12.0 #> 3   LGM38h   2011-02-20      Tier 3  Stratum height/m              5.0 #> 4   LGM38h   2011-02-20      Tier 4  Stratum height/m              2.0 #> 5   LGM38h   2011-02-20      Tier 5  Stratum height/m              0.3 #> 6   LGM45h   2011-02-11      Tier 1  Stratum height/m             25.0 #>   upperLimit_method upperLimit_value      str_1_method str_1_value #> 1  Stratum height/m               50 Recce cover scale           3 #> 2  Stratum height/m               25 Recce cover scale           3 #> 3  Stratum height/m               12 Recce cover scale           4 #> 4  Stratum height/m                5 Recce cover scale           5 #> 5  Stratum height/m                2 Recce cover scale           4 #> 6  Stratum height/m               50              <NA>        <NA>

FALSE plots never merged (.e. two VegX documents considered coming different vegetation data sources). allowMergeOrganismIdentities TRUE, allows organism identities sharing organismName merged. title: Merge Veg-X documents — mergeVegX
text: entities attempted merged kept separate entities depeding definition: projects merged element title value. plots merged, allowMergePlots = TRUE, value element plotName , defined,    plotUniqueIdentifier also equal. plotObservations merged plotID obsStartDate elements value organismIdentities merged share organismName allowMergeOrganismIdentities = TRUE   one can name used different data sets referring different concepts. methods merged element name value. strata merged element stratumName value corresponding method name. stratumObservations merged stratumID plotObservationID elements value. aggregateOrganismObservations merged plotObservationID organismIdentityID (stratumObservationID, defined) value individualOrganisms merged plotID individualOrganismLabel value. individualOrganismObservations merged plotObservationID individualOrganismID value. surfaceTypes merged element surfaceName value corresponding method name. surfaceCoverObservations merged surfaceTypeID plotObservationID elements value siteObservations merged element element plotObservationID value, particular measurements always added   distinct pieces information. Merging entities may cause interruption process two entities merged different value element. entities (e.g., attributes method) always considered distinct entities two data sets merged hence simply copied result.

title: Merge Veg-X documents — mergeVegX
code: data(mokihinui)  # Create document 'x' with aggregate taxon observations taxmapping = list(plotName = "Plot", obsStartDate = "PlotObsStartDate",               taxonName = "NVSSpeciesName",               stratumName = "Tier", cover = "Category") coverscale = defineOrdinalScaleMethod(name = "Recce cover scale",                description = "Recce recording method by Hurst/Allen",                subject = "plant cover",                citation = "Hurst, JM and Allen, RB. (2007)                     The Recce method for describing New Zealand vegetation – Field protocols.                     Landcare Research, Lincoln.",                codes = c("P","1","2","3", "4", "5", "6"),                quantifiableCodes = c("1","2","3", "4", "5", "6"),                breaks = c(0, 1, 5, 25, 50, 75, 100),                midPoints = c(0.05, 0.5, 15, 37.5, 62.5, 87.5),                definitions = c("Presence", "<1%", "1-5%","6-25%", "26-50%",                                     "51-75%", "76-100%")) strataDef = defineMixedStrata(name = "Recce strata",                description = "Standard Recce stratum definition",                citation = "Hurst, JM and Allen, RB. (2007)                   The Recce method for describing New Zealand vegetation – Field protocols.                   Landcare Research, Lincoln.",                heightStrataBreaks = c(0, 0.3,2.0,5, 12, 25, 50),                heightStrataNames = paste0("Tier ",1:6),                categoryStrataNames = "Tier 7",                categoryStrataDefinition = "Epiphytes") x = addAggregateOrganismObservations(newVegX(), moki_tcv, taxmapping,                methods = c(cover=coverscale),                stratumDefinition = strataDef) #>  1 additional aggregate organism measurements found: Category. #>  Measurement method 'Recce cover scale' added for 'cover'. #>  Stratum definition method 'Recce strata' added. #>  7 new stratum definitions added. #>  5 plot(s) parsed, 5 new added. #>  5 plot observation(s) parsed, 5 new added. #>  148 organism names(s) parsed, 148 new added. #>  148 organism identitie(s) parsed, 148 new added. #>  33 stratum observation(s) parsed, 33 new added. #>  582 record(s) parsed, 582 new aggregate organism observation(s) added.  # Create document 'y' with tree observations treemapping = list(plotName = "Plot", subPlotName = "Subplot", obsStartDate = "PlotObsStartDate",                    taxonName = "NVSSpeciesName", diameterMeasurement = "Diameter") diamMeth = predefinedMeasurementMethod("DBH/cm") y = addIndividualOrganismObservations(newVegX(), moki_dia, treemapping,                    methods = c(diameterMeasurement = diamMeth)) #>  Measurement method 'DBH/cm' added for 'diameterMeasurement'. #>  23 plot(s) parsed, 23 new added. #>  18 plot observation(s) parsed, 18 new added. #>  28 organism names(s) parsed, 28 new added. #>  0 taxon concept(s) parsed, 0 new added. #>  28 organism identitie(s) parsed, 28 new added. #>  0 individual organism(s) parsed, 643 new added. #>  643 record(s) parsed, 643 new individual organism observation(s) added.  # Merge 'x' and 'y' while keeping plots of the same name separate and # organism identities that have the same name separated. title: Transform ordinal scale — transformOrdinalScale
text: function normally create new measurements without destroying original ones, unless replacement forced setting replaceValues = TRUE. Veg-X allows single measurement per observations kinds: "diameterMeasurement" "heightMeasurement" indvidual organism observations. "heightMeasurement" aggregate organism observations. "lowerLimitMeasurement" "upperLimitMeasurement" stratum observations. cases, scale transformations possible replaceValues = FALSE.

title: Transform ordinal scale — transformOrdinalScale
code: data(mokihinui)  # Create Veg-X document with aggregate organism observations  # with ordinal cover scale taxmapping = list(plotName = "Plot", obsStartDate = "PlotObsStartDate",                taxonName = "NVSSpeciesName",               stratumName = "Tier", cover = "Category") coverscale = defineOrdinalScaleMethod(name = "Recce cover scale",                description = "Recce recording method by Hurst/Allen",                subject = "plant cover",                citation = "Hurst, JM and Allen, RB. (2007)                       The Recce method for describing New Zealand vegetation –                       Field protocols. Landcare Research, Lincoln.",                codes = c("P","1","2","3", "4", "5", "6"),                quantifiableCodes = c("1","2","3", "4", "5", "6"),                breaks = c(0, 1, 5, 25, 50, 75, 100),                midPoints = c(0.05, 0.5, 15, 37.5, 62.5, 87.5),                definitions = c("Presence", "<1%", "1-5%","6-25%",                                 "26-50%", "51-75%", "76-100%")) strataDef = defineMixedStrata(name = "Recce strata",                description = "Standard Recce stratum definition",                citation = "Hurst, JM and Allen, RB. (2007)                      The Recce method for describing New Zealand vegetation –                      Field protocols. Landcare Research, Lincoln.",                heightStrataBreaks = c(0, 0.3,2.0,5, 12, 25, 50),                heightStrataNames = paste0("Tier ",1:6),                categoryStrataNames = "Tier 7",                categoryStrataDefinition = "Epiphytes") x = addAggregateOrganismObservations(newVegX(), moki_tcv,                mapping = taxmapping,                methods = c(cover=coverscale),                stratumDefinition = strataDef) #>  1 additional aggregate organism measurements found: Category. #>  Measurement method 'Recce cover scale' added for 'cover'. #>  Stratum definition method 'Recce strata' added. #>  7 new stratum definitions added. #>  5 plot(s) parsed, 5 new added. #>  5 plot observation(s) parsed, 5 new added. #>  148 organism names(s) parsed, 148 new added. #>  148 organism identitie(s) parsed, 148 new added. #>  33 stratum observation(s) parsed, 33 new added. #>  582 record(s) parsed, 582 new aggregate organism observation(s) added.  #Add stratum observations with ordinal cover scale mapping = list(plotName = "Plot", obsStartDate = "PlotObsStartDate",                 stratumName = "Tier",                cover = "CoverClass")  x = addStratumObservations(x, moki_str,                         mapping = mapping,                         methods = list(cover=coverscale),                         stratumDefinition = strataDef) #>  1 stratum measurement variables found. #>  Measurement method 'Recce cover scale' for 'cover' already included. #>  Stratum definition 'Recce strata' already included. #>  5 plot(s) parsed, 0 new added. #>  5 plot observation(s) parsed, 0 new added. #>  35 record(s) parsed, 2 new stratum observation(s) added. #>  7 measurement(s) with missing value(s) not added.   # Transform from "Recce cover scale" to "Plant cover/%" percentScale = predefinedMeasurementMethod("Plant cover/%") y = transformOrdinalScale(x, "Recce cover scale", percentScale) #>  Target method: 'Recce cover scale' #>  Number of attributes: 7 #>  Number of quantifiable attributes with midpoints: 6 #>  Limits of the new attribute: [0, 100] #>  Measurement method 'Plant cover/%' added. #>  531 transformation(s) were applied on aggregate organism observations. #>  28 transformation(s) were applied on stratum observations.
